text: So for starters in the industry the best way is come through some graduate schemes like green light scheme at Dneg for example. You can check it out on their website. Or another way is to apply as a runner. Showreel shouldn’t be longer than 3mins and should show your best work. Once done you can show it to me and I can give feedback. But make sure it starts with your best work.

Networking is also the best way. Just like you are talking to me right now I can try to connect you with companies / connections when they are looking. If you talk to more people for example on LinkedIn , a lot more chances for you to get in

So for compositor role, the best way would be to start as a root artist so for instance if you start as a runner your can progress into roto and prep work, and then progress into junior comping and then work your way up

Right okay I will start looking into graduate schemes and looking for runner jobs. Would you suggest going for a bigger studio first or looking for a smaller studio to apply for? 

Okay perfect thank you :) when I get my showreel ready I'll show it to you. 

Yeah I have a LinkedIn page but I feel like I need to branch out more. Try and talk to more recruiters. 

Okay thank you for all the advise :) I have two more questions for now if that's okay? 

How long does it take to progress in industry? 

What are the opportunities like to work in other countries   (America, Canada, etc.)

To start you can apply everywhere , big and small studios . Wherever you can get in will be great. You just need to step in, doesn’t matter small or big studio. 
To progress into the industry , it really depends on the individual. Some people progress after and some take their time. You just really have to be very passionate, learn fast and that way you can move up fast. Attitude and work ethics are the most important. Gaining that respect and trust , leads and supervisors will trust you with more challenging work.
And yes vfx is one of the best industries where you are be able to work abroad and travel around. For example I work for Dneg and we have studios in LA and Canada , I know people who have asked for transfer. I know friends who have gone to Tokyo and Australia. ILM just opened a studio there.
